page.title: 03TEMPLETON FORGE.
page.content: Brian Owen is the village blacksmith. His father established the Forge in 1920 and Brian started working with his father in 1960.The workshop is in the main street of the village and is very important as it employs two men, Charlie and Robert.This is full-time employment,five days a week from 9am-6pm.Jean Owen, Brian's wife helps with the office work and answers the telephone.The work is very varied,from mending farm machinery for the large local farming community, to making ornamental metal work e.g.lights and garden fencing.Their latest project is making children's playground equipment for the camp sites and parks in the neighbourhood.Brian likes his work very much as it is a creative job.Each day is interesting with something different to mend or make.
